article.headline: Weber State 74, Montana 61
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Slobodan Ocokoljic made all of his shots and scored 19 points Saturday to lead Big Sky Conference preseason favorite Weber State to its first league win 74-61 over Montana. Ocokoljic made all three of his shots from the field, including a 3-pointer, and all 12 of his free throws, and grabbed 11 rebounds for the Wildcats (8-8, 1-2 Big Sky). Weber State was outscored from the field, but made 27 of 32 free throws as three Montana players fouled out and another had four fouls. Montana (5-11, 2-2) was 24-of-52 from the field, but just 9-of-12 from the free throw line. Pat Danley added 15 points for Weber, which pulled away from a 24-24 tie late in the first half and never trailed again. The Wildcats led 40-34 at halftime and held a 58-46 lead on a put-back by Troy Goodell with 9:50 to play. Steve Horne twice cut the deficit to five points for Montana, the last time at 62-57 on a basket with 5:50 remaining. Weber never scored another basket, but hit 12-of-14 free throws in the remainder of the game. Ocokoljic made eight of those free throws. Kevin Criswell led Montana with 16 points and Horne had 13. Criswell and Kamarr Davis, the Grizzlies' leading scorers coming in, sat out several minutes of the second half with four fouls apiece, and both fouled out in the last minute. Nic Sparrow scored 11 points for Weber and Lance Allred had 10.
